content: I'm trying to get rustc to use a different install of glibc than the one found at /lib64/libc.so.6. Is there some kind of -rpath flag I can pass to get rustc to look in /usr/local/toolchains/foo/lib64?
it doesn't seem to be affecting all libraries
Are there other flags or environment variables that might impact this behavior?

You can use -Clink-arg=-Wl,-rpath,/usr/local/toolchains/foo/lib64 to modify the rpath to a specific value. As for using a custom glibc I think -Clink-arg=--sysroot=/usr/local/toolchains/foo would be what you want.
